thread.title: Kevin De Bruyne admits Man City cannot be compared to Man United and Liverpool
thread.title_full: Kevin De Bruyne admits Man City cannot be compared to Man United and Liverpool

author: James Whaling
title: Kevin De Bruyne admits Man City cannot be compared to Man United and Liverpool
text:
Sport Kevin De Bruyne admits Man City cannot be compared to Man United and Liverpool The Belgian concedes it may take half a century for City to be seen at the same level as their counterparts Share De Bruyne has admitted City cannot be compared to Liverpool and United (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Manchester City star Kevin De Bruyne has admitted the Blues cannot be compared to fierce rivals Manchester United or Liverpool at present. 
Pep Guardiola's side are bidding to better last year's semi-final appearance in the Champions League as they prepare to host Monaco at the Eithad on Tuesday evening in the first leg of their last-16 tie. 
United and Liverpool have eight European Cups between them, and De Bruyne concedes it may take half a century for City to be seen at the same level as their counterparts. 
“People talk about teams like Man United and Liverpool, with the history they have,” said De Bruyne. De Bruyne and City are bidding for continental success (Photo: AFP) The Belgian has impressed since arriving at the Etihad (Photo: REUTERS) 
“Obviously they are great teams and you cannot compare us to them because we didn't have the time that they've had already for doing what they did in the Champions League. 
“They've been there for multiple years and we've only been there for five or six years. We need the same amount of time to compare to them in the Champions League. 
“For me (history means) nothing, but for a lot of people in the world it means everything. That's why people are talking about Man City a little bit less than they do the other teams. Will Pep lead City to European glory? (Photo: Alex Livesey) Read More Kevin De Bruyne believes he's playing better than last year despite fewer goals - 'I never look at my stats' 
“Everybody in England will be very proud about the English teams achieving a lot in Europe, but we also want the chance to try that. 
“If we do it for another 50 years and then we have a couple of Champions Leagues, people will maybe also look differently at us.” poll loading Will Man City ever match the stature of Man United and Liverpool? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
